title: How to use your diaphragm when singing - Quora

response.answer_text: Your diaphragm is a muscle located directly below your rib cage . take both of your hands and place them underneath your rib cage open your mouth and breathe in slowly through your mouth get used to what it feels like to expand the muscle. count out loud to 3 open your mouth and release the air slowly through your mouth This is what it feels like to breathe from your diaphragm. Now when you sing it's important that you use the same approach. Know ahead of time all the places in a song or vocal exercise that you are supposed to stop and breathe. Make sure you were breathing into your mouth. Release the air and the sound through your mouth.
